name: Gateway of India
description: A triumphal arch built to commemorate the arrival of British King George V and Queen Mary to India.

name: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Vastu Sangrahalaya (CSMVS)
description: Formerly known as the Prince of Wales Museum, it houses a vast collection of Indian art and artifacts.
image: [Image of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Vastu Sangrahalaya, Mumbai]

name: Marine Drive
description: A scenic 3.6 km boulevard known as the Queen's Necklace, offering stunning views of the Arabian Sea.

name: Mani Bhavan
description: The former residence of Mahatma Gandhi in Mumbai, now a museum dedicated to his life and work.

name: Bandra-Worli Sea Link
description: A cable-stayed bridge connecting Bandra and Worli, offering panoramic views of the Mumbai skyline.

name: Siddhivinayak Temple
description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Ganesha, known for its intricate carvings and being a popular pilgrimage site.

name: Sanjay Gandhi National Park
description: A large urban park offering nature trails, a variety of flora and fauna, and the Kanheri Caves.
image: [Image of Sanjay Gandhi National Park, Mumbai]

name: Victoria Terminus (CST)
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, this historic railway station is known for its Victorian Gothic architecture.

name: Colaba Causeway
description: A bustling street market known for its variety of shops selling souvenirs, clothing, and local crafts.

name: Taj Palace and Tower Hotel
description: A prestigious luxury hotel located near the Gateway of India in Mumbai, known for its distinctive architecture and history, symbolizing Indian hospitality.

name: Royal Bombay Yacht Club
description: An elite yacht club established in the 19th century, located in Mumbai, known for its maritime heritage and exclusive membership.

name: Dhanraj Mahal
description: A historic art deco building in Mumbai, originally built as a palatial residence, now housing offices and commercial spaces.

name: Regal Cinema
description: One of Mumbai's first Art Deco cinemas, opened in the early 20th century, known for its grandeur and architectural style.

name: Elphinstone College
description: A prestigious institution established in the 19th century, known for its Gothic architecture and significant contribution to India's educational landscape.

name: Horniman Circle
description: A large park surrounded by office buildings in Mumbai's Fort area, named after Benjamin Horniman, a British editor who supported Indian independence.

name: Bombay High Court
description: One of the oldest High Courts in India, known for its Gothic Revival architecture and as a symbol of the Indian judiciary system.

name: University of Mumbai
description: One of India's first three universities, known for its historic buildings and as a premier institution for higher education in India.

name: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus
description: A historic railway station and a UNESCO World Heritage Site, known for its Victorian Gothic architecture and as a major transportation hub in Mumbai.

name: Elephanta Caves
description: A network of sculpted caves located on Elephanta Island, near Mumbai, known for their ancient Hindu and Buddhist rock art.

name: Haji Ali Dargah
description: An iconic mosque and tomb located on an islet off the coast of Mumbai, known for its Indo-Islamic architecture and spiritual significance.

name: Rajabai Clock Tower
description: A clock tower within the University of Mumbai campus, inspired by Big Ben, known for its Gothic Revival architecture.

name: Kanheri Caves
description: A group of caves and rock-cut monuments located in Sanjay Gandhi National Park, known for their Buddhist influence and ancient inscriptions.

name: Tower of Silence
description: A Parsi or Zoroastrian funerary site in Mumbai, where the dead are exposed to the elements and birds of prey, in accordance with Zoroastrian tradition.

name: Flora Fountain
description: An ornate fountain located in the heart of Mumbai, named after the Roman Goddess Flora, known for its architectural beauty and historical significance.

name: Antilia
description: A private 27-story residence in Mumbai, known as one of the most expensive homes in the world, belonging to Mukesh Ambani.
